reviews.text:
Last night we had our dinner at Bistro Aseana Pasta & Skewer Bar ,  Don exceeded expectations! ðŸ¥° His warm hospitality, prompt service and menu expertise made our dining experience unforgettable. The food was outstanding, and the atmosphere was cozy and inviting.
We'll definitely return! ðŸ¥°
Located at Merlion park. Mostly serves on the go fast food. Their tacos were very delicious. They offer outdoor seating.

Donkey and I, regular patrons of this establishment, are excited to provide our feedback. Our favorite choice is the yakiniku beef and French fries set wrapped in a fried bun, which we find quite delightful. Despite its compact size, the burger offers a satisfying two-bite experience. Conveniently located near the Merlion, Bistro Aseana is always bustling with customers. Comprising three adjoining shops, it offers a range of options from ice cream desserts to bistro-style dishes like spaghetti and steak. Our top pick, the Tiger Prawn & Half Shell Scallop Aglio Olio, was elevated with an extra sprinkle of cheese and Tabasco sauce. We also took advantage of the beer set promotion at Review Inn.

While there are varied opinions on Google reviews, personally, we found the food to be satisfactory. The flavors of the two-mouthful beef and fried beef burger bun were commendable, and the service met our expectations. Therefore, we are rating this establishment with 4 stars.
Good food and view. The skewers are delicious. The staff are also friendly. The price is okay considering the location. There are just many tourist walking around especially on weekends.

Kitty and I have frequented this place several times, and today we are sharing our review. Our go-to choice is the fried bun with yakiniku beef and French fries set, which we find quite enjoyable. Despite its small size, the burger is a delightful two-bite option. Situated conveniently behind the Merlion, this establishment always attracts a crowd. Bistro Aseana comprises three neighboring shops, offering a variety of options from ice cream desserts to bistro-style dishes like spaghetti and steak. Our pick, the Tiger Prawn & Half Shell Scallop Aglio Olio, tasted even better with an extra sprinkle of cheese and Tabasco sauce. We also indulged in the beer set promotion at Review Inn.

Despite the mixed reviews on Google, we personally found the food to be acceptable. The two-mouthful beef and fried beef burger bun were delicious, and the service was acceptable. Therefore, we are giving this establishment a 4-star rating.
